2987c709-dd32-401c-9100-f34bd01172e7.description: The WW Teaching Fellowship seeks to attract talented, committed individuals with backgrounds in the STEM fields—science, technology, engineering, and mathematics—into teaching in high-need secondary schools in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Indiana, Michigan, New Jersey, and Ohio. Earners of this badge attended a full day of sessions that focused on STEM and online learning best practices.
2987c709-dd32-401c-9100-f34bd01172e7.name: Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium Participant

issuer.summary: issued by The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

entity.name: The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: This badge is given to those who participated in the Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium on June 20, 2020.

5de40157-57ca-4ef4-8e3c-3e05b6fd3fc2.description: The earner of this badge has received one of the Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Microgrants. This prestigious program recognizes Indiana Teaching Fellows with small amounts of funding to attend or present at professional conferences, buy teaching materials for their classrooms, or complete community-based service-learning projects. This earner has strengthened their own teaching and sparked their students’ interest in the STEM fields (science, technology, engineering, and math).
5de40157-57ca-4ef4-8e3c-3e05b6fd3fc2.name: Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium Microgrant Recipient

issuer.summary: issued by The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

entity.name: The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a proposal for a microgrant from the Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship.
Provide a presentation to document outcomes and achievements as a result of the microgrant.

87d5c1d8-3cd2-4529-80f5-b3cc740d4e10.description: This badge recognizes individuals who have exhibited thought leadership and support for remote teaching and learning during COVID-19. By developing and delivering a session at the WW Teaching Fellowship’s STEM Teaching and Learning During Challenging Times virtual symposium for secondary STEM educators earners of this badge demonstrate online public speaking skills, collaboration, and the ability to modify STEM subjects from in person learning to online learning.
87d5c1d8-3cd2-4529-80f5-b3cc740d4e10.name: Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium Featured Speaker

issuer.summary: issued by The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

entity.name: The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Presented and facilitated discussions during the Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium.

61eac216-a934-486b-ae46-5dcc9be860a3.description: As part of the virtual symposium on June 20, 2020 a panel of students were convened to help teachers understand remote learning from the student perspective during and after COVID-19. These high school students were from Georgia, Indiana, New Jersey, and California. Students addressed their challenges and concerns, as well as their thoughts on what teachers and other educators should consider in supporting their academic achievement and socio-emotional development.
61eac216-a934-486b-ae46-5dcc9be860a3.name: Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium Student Panelists

issuer.summary: issued by The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

entity.name: The Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: This badge is given those those students that participated as panelists during the Woodrow Wilson Teachers Fellowship Virtual Symposium held on June 20, 2020.

b0281b06-fbb4-4e64-9e30-e8ea1642d92c.description: The earner of this badge assisted in the development and implementation of the Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium. This individual is able to work collaboratively at a distance, achieve results, and demonstrate outstanding communication and coordination. The earner has a professional interest in STEM professional development and shows a commitment to furthering inquiry and learning for diverse groups of participants.
b0281b06-fbb4-4e64-9e30-e8ea1642d92c.name: Woodrow Wilson Teaching Fellowship Virtual Symposium Planning Team
